com.example.android.BluetoothChat
Class BluetoothChatService

java.lang.Object
  com.example.android.BluetoothChat.BluetoothChatService

public class BluetoothChatService
extends java.lang.Object

This class does all the work for setting up and managing Bluetooth connections with other devices. It has a thread that listens for incoming connections, a thread for connecting with a device, and a thread for performing data transmissions when connected.

Nested Class Summary
private  class BluetoothChatService.AcceptThread
          This thread runs while listening for incoming connections.
private  class BluetoothChatService.ConnectedThread
          This thread runs during a connection with a remote device.
private  class BluetoothChatService.ConnectThread
          This thread runs while attempting to make an outgoing connection with a device.

Set the current state of the chat connection

Parameters:

getState

public int getState()
Return the current connection state.

start

public void start()
Start the chat service. Specifically start AcceptThread to begin a session in listening (server) mode. Called by the Activity onResume()

connect

public void connect(BluetoothDevice device,
                    boolean secure)
Start the ConnectThread to initiate a connection to a remote device.

Parameters:
device - The BluetoothDevice to connect
secure - Socket Security type - Secure (true) , Insecure (false)

connected

                      BluetoothDevice device,
                      java.lang.String socketType)
Start the ConnectedThread to begin managing a Bluetooth connection

Parameters:
socket - The BluetoothSocket on which the connection was made
device - The BluetoothDevice that has been connected
